current_ontology.title: Financial Reporting Ontology
current_ontology.description: The Financial Reporting Ontology (finont) provides a structured representation of financial reports, companies, stocks, financial statements, and associated disclosures. It aims to facilitate the understanding and interoperability of financial data across different systems and applications. This ontology can be used by financial analysts, software developers, and researchers to model and analyze financial information, including earnings reports, market risks, legal proceedings, and risk factors.

ontology_addendum.title: Financial Reporting Ontology
ontology_addendum.description: The Financial Reporting Ontology (finont) provides a structured representation of financial reports, companies, stocks, financial statements, and associated disclosures. It aims to facilitate the understanding and interoperability of financial data across different systems and applications. This ontology can be used by financial analysts, software developers, and researchers to model and analyze financial information, including earnings reports, market risks, legal proceedings, and risk factors.

failure_stage: The produced graph of facts did not pass the critique stage.
failure_reason: The knowledge graph is missing several important facts from the document. Specifically, it does not include the following: 1. The 'Commission File Number' (001-36743) is not represented. 2. The 'I.R.S. Employer Identification No.' (94-2404110) is missing. 3. The 'Address of principal executive offices' (One Apple Park Way, Cupertino, California, 95014) is not included. 4. The 'Registrant's telephone number' ((408) 996-1010) is absent. 5. The 'Total net sales' for the three months ended April 1, 2023 ($94,836 million) is not captured. 6. The 'Total cost of sales' for the three months ended April 1, 2023 ($52,860 million) is missing. 7. The 'Gross margin' for the three months ended April 1, 2023 ($41,976 million) is not included. 8. The 'Income before provision for income taxes' for the three months ended April 1, 2023 ($28,382 million) is absent. 9. The 'Provision for income taxes' for the three months ended April 1, 2023 ($4,222 million) is missing. 10. The 'Earnings per share' (Basic: $1.53, Diluted: $1.52) for the three months ended April 1, 2023 is not fully represented. 11. The 'Shares used in computing earnings per share' (Basic: 15,787,154, Diluted: 15,847,050) is not included.
